titles.title: A resolution recognizing the uncommon valor of Wesley Autrey of New York, New York.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

calendar.text: Committee on the Judiciary. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on the Judiciary. Reported by Senator Leahy without amendment and with a preamble. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 13.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

bill.summary: 1/26/2007--Passed Senate without amendment. Recognizes that Wesley Autry of New York, New York, acted heroically by putting his own life at risk to save that of a fellow citizen. Expresses the Senate's deep appreciation for his example and the values that his actions represent.
